basics.name: Pavlos Anastasiadis
basics.label: Data Analyst. Computer Science, Management Graduate
basics.summary: IT Management studies graduate with expertise in computer science and data analytics. Proactive in developing opportunities demonstrated by entrepreneurship when collaborating with others to start up a B2B distribution-wholesale business.

work.summary: K.A.S. is a company that specialises in coffee distributionby implementing modern day supply chain methodologies such as integrated logistics and creating new communication channels like the KAS B2Bapp.
highlights: Created the initial business strategy alongside the company's founder, Stylianos K. and planned pivot efforts tomitigate impact of COVID-19 which resulted in maintaining profits and the business' viability.
Leveraging data and conducting market research to assess opportunities for expansion within Greece and Europe.

work.summary: As a student ambassador I worked for the recruiting team of Lancaster University´s Management School, which is responsible of reaching out to prospective students and assisting with their applications and integration to the University environment
highlights: After a couple of months of working the recruitment team trusted me with delivering online seminars on my own and with writing the blog-post for my correspondent course

I had the opportunity to develop commercial awareness. Although my employer encouraged to be truthful throughout my interactions with prospective students, they appreciated my ability to convey enthusiasm and pride in regard to my school and what it had to offer.

I was asked to assist Lancaster university by attending the QS (Quacquarelli Symonds) World Grad School Tour as an alumnus and to speak with prospective students about what Lancaster university has to offer.

volunteering.summary: Academic reps are elected students that work for the student union. As an academic rep you serve as the communication channel between your classmates and the department, passing thoughts, concerns and requests as well as campaigning for the improvement of the student body experience.
highlights: Participating in forums with academic reps of other departments and debating on the ideas and feedback we gathered.
Taking part in additional skill development classes which assisted me in doing my job better.

volunteering.summary: As a radio presenter I got to have my own show which was broadcasted live every week. I got to learn the ins and outs of a radio station as well as the technology that supports it.
highlights: Collaborating with other members to create events
Getting a first hand experience in media production

volunteering.summary: As a freshers' rep I represented my college and university as I facilitated the introduction and integration of a group of first years.
highlights: The first week, known as freshers’ week, was the most daunting as I needed to act as guide and a friend for a large amount of people simultaneously. However, it also taught a lot of freshers’ reps how to improvise and cooperate as well as how to lead newly formed teams.
